p: Conversely, other species like Jasonia saxatilis (Lam.) Guss., Santolina chamaecyparissus L. subsp. squarrosa (DC.) Nyman or Dictamnus hispanicus Webb ex Willk., commonly growing and frequently reported in the present studied area, are not the most common in top positions in other territories, where they are less abundant or not present. This fact reflects the well-confirmed idea that the closer to civilization a plant grows, the more it is used by local people [ 67].
